alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 03 at 7:32PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Shingle Creek At Campbell affecting Osceola County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian has Shingle Creek at Campbell in Major Flood Stage. The river remains well above Record Flood Stage and crested on Saturday at around 64.2 feet. A very slow decline will occur through midweek, but levels will remain in Major Flood Stage. Interests along the river should expect historical flood impacts into midweek. For the Shingle Creek...including Campbell...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1100 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Record flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shingle Creek At Campbell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 62.3 feet, Water enters many homes in Good Samaritan Village. Water approaches Sherwood Forest manufactured homes. Streets in Camelot and Sherwood Forest not navigable by regular vehicles. Property and roads in southern Old Town receiving water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EDT Monday the stage was 63.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EDT Monday was 63.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 62.6 feet late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 60.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Shingle Creek Campbell 60.0 63.3 Mon 6 pm 62.8 MSG MSG MSG MSG &&
